channel.title: Odd as fuck
channel.description: Alright, for the past 2-3 days I have been thinking minecraft.net was down, only to be told by Shrogg it still works for him. I tried it on my phone and it loaded up fine. On my laptop though, I try to go to minecraft.net or even login with the launcher and I get no connection at all. Anybody have an idea as to why my laptop cannot even get a connection to minecraft? I wanna say I musta got IP'd for something (what though?), but that issue seems to be bad practice for Notch, as i barely ever got on SMP.

item.title: Odd as fuck
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:18, topic:382458”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=478252.msg3502434#msg3502434 date=1297833180]

BAHAHAHA! That’s exactly what I did to my brothers computer, which is what I was going to tell you after you posted those results. I just pointed all the SWG domain names to localhost, and it took him a month or two to figure it out. Man was he ever pissed, it was hilarious!

Now the question is, who did it to you?

My thing is, nobody in my household has really much knowledge of the computer except me, so it was a virus. I scanned my computer and I had 1 trojan downloader, but no real virus. I just took away my ownership of that file so it cannot be edited again lmfao.

From the looks of it, it was trying to steal your user/pass for minecraft. Are you sure it wasn’t something minecraft related?

That’s what originally came to mind, but I only have 1 mod installed. Then again, after I think about it, MCCheat was put on here by my uncle. My AVG found a virus each time I ran it. Also, after thinking about it, I had multiple occurrences of those redirects in my ‘hosts’ file. I guess I shall no longer let my uncle download things, time to limit the ‘guest’ account to browsing the web, playing games, and watching movies. No downloads for him anymore
[/quote]
Lol

Well if it found viruses, i would recommend scanning with something like spyware doctor, found trojan downloaders and a bunch of other things that AVG and a bunch of other antivirus softwares couldnt find.

Also try malware bytes :D[/quote]
To be quite honest I haven’t had a virus that’s gotten past AVG yet, not to say that I wont. I figured it out though after ripping apart the program, it was supposed to get me redirected into a fake minecraft login server that would then save my user and pass on his computer. It never sent bytes back (but it might not anyways), so I believe it was an old file or something.

Read full topic

Possibly a “M31ncr0ft ch34t 3ng1n3”?

Maybe it could be a keylogger, considering it attemped to steal data via key strokes, but that possibility is eliminated, since something happened with the website, i dont think it would be a keylogger, usually for stealing any valuable info, but as MITB said, something minecraft related, made specifically for stealing minecraft private info.

AVG says nothing about it when I search it on google (safe search addon).

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:382458”]BAHAHAHA! That’s exactly what I did to my brothers computer, which is what I was going to tell you after you posted those results. Now the question is, who did it to you? :P[/quote]
My thing is, nobody in my household has really much knowledge of the computer except me, so it was a virus. I scanned my computer and I had 1 trojan downloader, but no real virus. I just took away my ownership of that file so it cannot be edited again lmfao.

item.title: Odd as fuck
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:5, topic:382458”]Hehe, I did this to my brothers computer when he was addicted to SWG (Star Wars Galaxies) to stop him from playing it, it took him about a month to figure it out.

Open up a command line, and type ‘nslookup minecraft.net’ and post what comes up, I bet the DNS isn’t resolving right.[/quote]
Alright, I tried that and it seems I am just getting no response.

After seeing that, I decided it wasn’t a networking problem, but maybe it wasn’t being sent correctly. After remembering what the ‘hosts’ file does, I looked there and found this.

I traced the IP and found he (or at least the IP) originates from Chicago (or an nearby area/internet provider, as this site is not the most accurate thing).
http://www.ip-adress.com/ip_tracer/99.198.121.104

Minecraft.net and such all load find now lmfao.

Read full topic

item.title: Odd as fuck
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I Vain I:

Could be your http referrer?

I thought of that too, so I tested it on my old laptop. The results > Minecraft game wont load since it is incompatable with the OpenGL my video card on there supports, but the minecraft site loads just fine. There has gotta b something going on internally with my computer. I guess I’ll see about forcing a scan with my antivirus.

Read full topic
